ATENOLOL

BETA-ADRENOCEPTOR BLOCKERS (SYSTEMIC)

  • Indications and doses
  • Renal impairment
  • Administration
  • Unlicensed use
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Hypertension,

By mouth

  • For adults
    25–50 mg daily, higher doses are rarely necessary.

Angina,

By mouth

  • For adults
    100 mg daily in 1–2 divided doses.

Arrhythmias,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    50–100 mg daily.
  • For adults
    2.5 mg every 5 minutes (max. per dose 10 mg), repeated if necessary, given at a rate of 1 mg/minute.
  • For adults
    150 micrograms/kg every 12 hours if required, to be given over 20 minutes.

Migraine prophylaxis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    50–200 mg daily in divided doses.

Early intervention within 12 hours of myocardial infarction,

Initially by intravenous injection

  • For adults
    Initially 5 mg, to be given over 5 minutes, followed by (by mouth) 50 mg after 15 minutes, then (by mouth) 50 mg after 12 hours, then (by mouth) 100 mg daily.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Max. 50 mg daily (10 mg on alternate days intravenously) if eGFR 15–35 mL/minute/ 1.73 m2; max. 25 mg daily or 50 mg on alternate days (10 mg every 4 days intravenously) if eGFR less than 15 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Directions for administration

With intravenous use

For intravenous infusion (Tenormin ), give intermittently in Glucose 5% or Sodium chloride 0.9%. Suggested infusion time 20 minutes.

Unlicensed use

Use of atenolol for migraine prophylaxis is an unlicensed indication.

Prepared medicinal forms of ATENOLOL

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral suspension, oral solution,
Tablet
Oral solution
Solution for injection
